content: Singaporean actorThis biography of a living person **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Andrew Seow" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(May 2011)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Andrew Seow** (born 1969 or 1970) is a Singaporean former actor and model. ## Early life Seow studied at [St. Patrick's School](/wiki/Saint_Patrick%27s_School,_Singapore) and [Catholic High School](/wiki/Catholic_High_School,_Singapore). He earned an [Advanced Diploma](/wiki/Advanced_Diploma) in fashion design, jewellery design and merchandising from [Lasalle-SIA College of the Arts](/wiki/Lasalle-SIA_College_of_the_Arts). ## Career Seow was a model in Singapore and in other parts of Asia before becoming an actor on local television. He is best known for his role as the fiery tempered eldest son Gary Tay in the long-running drama series *[Growing Up](/wiki/Growing_Up_(Singaporean_TV_series))* on [MediaCorp TV Channel 5](/wiki/Channel_5_(Singaporean_TV_channel)), a role which earned him the Best Newcomer in the annual [Asian Television Awards](/wiki/Asian_Television_Awards) in 1996. Seow has also starred in numerous Chinese-language dramas on [Channel 8](/wiki/Channel_8_(Singaporean_TV_channel)), garnering nominations in the annual [Star Awards](/wiki/Star_Awards). Seow was talent-spotted by a [Television Corporation of Singapore](/wiki/Television_Corporation_of_Singapore) (TCS) producer in 1996 and subsequently joined TCS. In the mid-90s, Seow, Jason Oh, [Thomas Ong](/wiki/Thomas_Ong), Raymond Yong and Henry Tee formed the boy group *The Dragons Five*, which was named after the Channel 8 series of the same title. Since 2010, Seow has been a Senior Curator with Tsu Ho Gallery which specializes in fine art, antiques and jewellery. In 2025, Seow was working as an auxiliary police officer with security firm [Aetos](/wiki/Aetos_Security_Management). ## Filmography ### Television series YearWorkRoleNotesRef1995*Sparks Of Life* 生命火花*The Dragons Five* 飞龙五将1996*Unbroken Cycle* 解连环1996-1997*[Triple Nine](/wiki/Triple_Nine_(TV_series))*2 seasons1996-2001*[Growing Up](/wiki/Growing_Up_(Singaporean_TV_series))*Gary Tay6 seasons1999*Shiver**Dreamers* *(Wheels)**Can I Help You*Sitcom2001*[The Hotel](/wiki/The_Hotel_(Singaporean_TV_series))**My Genie* 我爱精灵2003*Love Is Beautiful* 美丽家庭*My Genie 2* 我爱精灵 II2004*[Man at Forty](/wiki/Man_at_Forty)*Tang Tang*[Spice Siblings](/wiki/Spice_Siblings)**[A Child's Hope II](/wiki/A_Child%27s_Hope)**The Ties That Bind* 家财万贯2005*[My Lucky Charm](/wiki/My_Lucky_Charm)**[Zero to Hero](/wiki/Zero_to_Hero_(TV_series))**[A New Life](/wiki/A_New_Life_(Singaporean_TV_series))*2006*[The Undisclosed](/wiki/The_Undisclosed)* ## Theatre - *Close: In Your Face* by The Necessary Stage (2002) ## Awards and nominations OrganisationYearCategoryNominated workResultRef[Asian Television Awards](/wiki/Asian_Television_Awards)1996Best Newcomer in a Drama Series*[Growing Up](/wiki/Growing_Up_(Singaporean_TV_series))* (as Gary Tay)Won[Star Awards](/wiki/Star_Awards)(/wiki/Star_Awards_2004)[Best Supporting Actor](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Supporting_Actor)*[Man at Forty](/wiki/Man_at_Forty)* (as Tang Tang)Won This article about a Singaporean actor is a stub. title: Andrew Seow
